Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DaddyYo
Reviews.Content: The absolute best thing about this hotel, and perhaps the only very good thing, was the service. A young lady named Cornelia went above and beyond to make this stay enjoyable. Unfortunately, she could not overcome the small, uncomfortable rooms. I choose this hotel for the price and location. It was very close to the office I was visiting, and the price was right. The rooms were small, the desk was awkward and uncomfortable, and the bed was extremely uncomfortable. I think the floor would have been more comfortable, but there was not enough floor space available. I stayed two nights, and when I returned to my room on the second day, it appeared that housekeeping made the bed. And that's all. The desk had not been wiped down and the floor and bathroom did not appear to be cleaned. The bathroom appeared to an afterthought. It resembled a modularized restroom that one would find on a boat. The size reflected this as well. The restaurant had a decent menu, but was out of several items when I tried to order lunch on my first day. The breakfast selection was rather lean, but considering the price I should not have been surprised. The hotel was hosting at least one group from EF Tours. I believe that they were high school students from Pennsylvania. When I returned one evening hoping to have a beer in the restaurant, the school kids had pretty much taken over the place. I took the beer to my uncomfortable room instead. On my next trip, I will pay more and have a comfortable room and sacrifice the convenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING IBIS MERIDIANA”
Reviews.Author: roberto n Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: unfortunately our experience at the Ibis Barcelona Meridiana was very very bad. On April 3 in the morning, two people broke into the hotel lobby and stole my wife's purse. The hotel concierge does not have any security system. It happened inside the hotel. The hotel manager Mr Joao Carlos Santos said "the guest is totally responsible of your personal belongs even inside the hotel" and could not do anything about it !!!. I asked the record it in the local police authorities. Knowing that thieves are circulating the area, the hotel does not make any warnings about the risk and also there is no worry about the safety of their guests. I insist that the robbery took place inside the hotel lobby. Regrettable !!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, poor location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: littlepie
Reviews.Content: Clean and good size room and bathroom. Quite detached from the town centre and is quite a distance walk from the metro station. Very unsafe to walk through the walk to get to the metro. Situated in Heron city which has a few shops and restaurants. The is a bit of a language barrier as the hotel staff can speak English. They didn't give us a wake up call when requested. Furtermore, the hotel do don't have a trusted allocated taxi company (you would need a taxi to get to the airport for morning flights) and you are left on your own accord. Poor customer service

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff and remote location”
Reviews.Author: Hampstead30
Reviews.Content: Aside from the isolated location and the unwelcoming staff, the rooms are actually very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were all nice, helpful and attentive. The room was kept clean. The temperature in the room could be regulated, there was no unpleasant smell, I did not hear my neighbours because the walls were thick enough. Free Internet at the lobby. The breakfast was just fine with me. Price is right. Hotel is next to a shopping complex. It is a bit of a walk from the metro station but it's Line 1 so with it, you can go to many tourist spots without changing line(s). I had an accident next to the hotel and the hotel staff helped me get a taxi and explained to the taxi where to take me. He also explained to me how to return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: distance10
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel for the formula 1 race in May. It s a typical Ibis one, clean and with very helpful stuff. As I was travelling with a friend of mine, I asked for a room with two beds and instead of giving me a room with two single ones, they were so generous to offer us a triple room!!! Of course one of us had to sleep on the single bed, but the friend of mine sleeping on the double was comfortable enough. The breakfast for Barcelona s relation was cheap, and very tasty with high standards of quality. What I really loved is that the personal is speaking several foreign languages such as English, German and French, which made our stay very convenient. Next to the hotel, there is a practical shopping center with plenty of Cafes and Restaurants (I loved the American one), metro and another rail station as well, which brought us to the Airport and Montmello. The only disadvantages would be maybe, that it was impossible to open our window to ventilate the room, that the Internet had cost 10E per day and the size of the room, which is a little crappy. All in All, the hotel is a good average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were very accomodating to our request for an additional night. The location was good to facilities and the staff explained the transport options extremely well. I enjoyed my time in Bacerlona and would certainly recommend the Hotel to other friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nikandlesley
Reviews.Content: You know what you are getting when you book an IBIS. The room, bar and breakfast could be anywhere on the planet. So what is different about this. Car Parking - it's in the shopping centre next door. It felt safe as there was security on site 24hr. Not that expensive when the hotel discount is taken into account. You would be better dropping luggage off in the street outside the hotel first before parking. This isn't a problem as there is plenty of space and not traffic wardens. We had a satnav (GPS) and used the co-ordinants from google earth to pinpoint where to go. Location - It's about a 10 min walk to the metro. Which links you to the centre of Barcelona. The walk is pleasant and seemed very safe with lots of people around at all times or the day and night. Lots of people jogging, playing football, playing basketball, walking, strolling or just sitting and watching the world. One tip is to but a carnet of ten metro tickets. This can be used by a group and not just by one person and can be used on buses. We felt safe on the metro, although it got very hot towards the end of the day in the stations (the trains have aircon). Shopping - the shopping centre is a bit of disappointment and is not really an outlet centre. The department store next to the hotel, El Corté Ingles, is great. All 7 floors! It even has a food department (supermarket) on the lower ground floor. Great for stocking up with water and picnic stuff. Eating - Only have breakfast at the hotel, which was adequate. The restaurants in the shopping centre are average. Better to go into the city centre to eat. My favourite was the one on the top of the stadium shopping centre at Espanya (there's a metro station there). Great views of the city from the top. Remember they eat later in Spain (9pm+). This hotel is not 4/5 starts, but you know that when you book. The staff, who all speak English, are very helpful. There is free internet in the lobby via a PC, but there is only one PC. Other than that you have to pay (free wifi in McDonalds in the shopping centre). The rooms are on the smallish side but I do not expect to spend much time there other than sleeping. I loved Barcelona. I would go there without question again. There is so much to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “A very good deal”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our week long stay,in clean, quiet and comfortable surroundings. The efficient, friendly and informative staff were a plus.Our only reservations were the rather long walk to and from the Metro and the lack of sign posts indicating the location of the hotel; However the weather remained fine and these are rather minor quibbles compared with the quality of the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst ever - Avoid”
Reviews.Author: specialk23
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest and admit I don't normally stay at this level of hotel - but I was desparate because Barcelona was booked out on my dates. Despite this I can only say that this place is the pits. Location is OK because there are 2 shopping centres and restaurants. But: - I had a firm reservation which they tried to deny - the staff were unhelpful and rude - there was no desk - I had to work with laptop in my lap in bed - breakfast was not good Will never ever stay in this Brand again

Reviews.Title: “ITMA Show”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and the beds are comfortable, There is also very little noise from the street. But unfortunately the trip on the underground to the centre of Barcelona is a little too long if you are only staying for a few days. At least the underground is cheap and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona - Ibis 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rate between price and location is high. I think it could be smaller considering the price in other cities and same type of acomodation we can find in other countries. But, the staff was very friend and the price of the services as breakfast reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: hannahb1505
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel just to collapse in after a morning/day of sightseeing barcelona, this hotel is perfect. Although its on the outskirts, the nearest metro has a direct line to the city centre which took 15 minutes. The room was big and clean, and although there is a shopping centre with a cinema next door the triple glazing ensured a quiet nights sleep. The staff were very helpful, offering us many reviews and recommendations on places to visit and restaurants to eat at. The one bad thing about this hotel is that the walk from the metro to the hotel was a little too long- it being in the direct sun left you tired

Reviews.Title: “Good food and staff, inconvenient parking”
Reviews.Author: laurielee1midsummer
Reviews.Content: Multilingual staff, modern and reasonably spacious room for three. Didn't venture out as we were tired but not particularly eye-candy locale. Ate inside and the paella, bolognese and (especially) tarta de manzana surprisingly good. Friendly waiter/cook with decent English but also happy to let me use my Spanish. Only place for smoking is on the street front but, despite Barça's reputation, I didn't feel troubled. Worst aspect is the underground parking that entailed dragging our luggage through a busy shopping complex and the streets but the hotel discounts the cost to about 8 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for Affordable Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Shanisha
Reviews.Content: Affordable Clean Not to far from City/ Beach Local shopping centre Breakfast was fair not great (I would wait to book the breakfast until you taste it and see the options upon arrival) Desk really did not know good English

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and can any day plan to come back”
Reviews.Author: Anuj_Bandlish
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite spacious, clean and comfortable. Placed at an ideal location, right next to a mall and cineplex. There are a lot of eating joints in the mall, so one has a lot of options to eat around. If traveling with the kids, you have a good playing area and gardens near the hotel. Public transportation is a bit far. Requires 15 - 20 minutes walk. View from the hotel is too good. Akbar tower, la Sagrada is viewable from hotel rooms as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Barcelona Meridiana one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is terrible. Far from any public transportation. When it comes to the service it gets even worse. Had to ask several times to get fresh towels after 3 days. The lifts were in awefull condition. The bottoms were missing so if one needed to go for example to the 7th floor he/she should choose 6th or 8th (whichever was available) and take the stairs for the remaining one or two floors.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonably Priced, Comfortable and Clean Crash Pad For Touring The Wonderful City Of Barcelona! >5 Stars<”
Reviews.Author: md23040
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with two rooms adjoining and booked through the internet with a special rate of €259 including breakfast all in (incidentally breakfasts for under 12’s free, 13-15 year olds 3€ and 6.50€ for adults). The reception staff were efficient, very friendly and spoke a multiple of different languages and overall helpful in providing useful information about the City. There is free parking on the street but we decided to leave into the adjoining multi storey car park at 12.50€ per day. The hotel is close to the Metro but also it is easy to drive into the centre of Barcelona that’s about 7km away. Could not recommend this hotel enough. IBIS are like Mc Donald’s in that they all look similar in terms of room size, layout, very clean,with good quality breakfast. This is a modern hotel with very comfortable beds, air-con rooms and sound proofed windows. Also there is a free Internet computer at reception that’s really helpful for travel and tourist information. Finally if there is any problem, ACCOR IBIS has a 15 minute pledge that if it cannot be fixed then there are further discounts or a free stay. What more of an assurance can a hotel provide?

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and neat and the room was nice. The bed is very comfortable and there is enough space in locker for stuff. TV-set has programs in English, German, Spanish, French. The staff speaks English and they all are very helpful. There is Metro close by the hotel. The only problem that we had, was with the air-conditioner - it does not work properly and in the room, one can not open the window (we could not estimate the temperature of the air). Anyway, we would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good conections & local services”
Reviews.Author: lynx003uk Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A modern typical Ibis hotel, situated adjacent to a shopping centre and multi screen cinema. A 4min walk from Railway & Metro Station. Rooms situated on floors 4 -> 14 of a towerblock with good views over the city. No smoking rooms available. Restaurant facilities are limited, as with all Ibis hotels, breakfast being well presented, and snacks available all day. However ther is a large selection of cafes and restaruants in the shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great checkin and checkout experience. Front-desk staff very helpful with advice in getting around and what to see. Room very clean and serviced daily. Breakfast facility very basic and not inviting. Location about a 15-min underground ride to city centre

Reviews.Title: “I would come back.Good service at good price”
Reviews.Author: rainbow0161
Reviews.Content: we had two rooms. we went for a funeral so our mood was not the best but I also had the chance to reunite with my sister so not so bad. The welcome was fine. The baby cot was there as I requested (even though it looked like a laundry trolley).Room was I expected tidy and clean and my systers as well, even bigger than the ones I saw in England for the same chain. Night staff were less helpfull than morning as we had to extend our stay and they wouldnt honor the same special rate as we had the night before but they solved it in the morning. When we tried to speak to the manager in the morning wasnt there (as she had an email confirming our rate) but also the recepcionist said she wouldn't call her or check her email to confirm it.Breakfast coffe didnt look very good but it tasted great so very impressed. Overall our stay was good I would come back definetely, maybe with the email confirmation printed to avoid the hassel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, better than average”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you would expect from an Ibis hotel. It is close to a metro station and a shopig mall. The rooms are relatively smal but clean. The staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Building work”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel with easy access to the Metro but there was building work in the reception which was very noisy when we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good place for short stay and for those who want to explore suroundings of Barcelona. Some people may be happy with close shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but star rating appropriate, I suppose”
Reviews.Author: freelance87
Reviews.Content: If you dont mind a short trip to get to the hotel from the city centre, you'll be satisfied. Closest metro station - Fabra i Puig is some 10 walking minutes far through a park and chilrden playground. Nice to see elderly people playing pétanque and smoking cigars while reading newspapers. What a change in comparison with Prague! You choose this hotel because you want to see something from ordinary local life, not because it close to Placa Catalunya (by the way, what is so significant on that square that everyone is considering it the middle of everything??). The hotel itself is simple, c/i was quick, the receptionist gave us a map and marked the hotel and also Placa Catalunya (*sigh*). The bathroom looks like in a space station, but you get your amenities, hair dryer, etc. I you want a twin room, prepare for the fact that one of you will sleep in an extra bed (personall I found it more comfy than the bigger one) and the other one in queen sized one. There is a TV with some UK channels, so you will not be cut off from the news. Breakfast was nice, continental style. Staff was friendly and nice. Special thanks to Eric for sending me an invoice. However, for a wi-fi you need to pay extra €5 a day. You better go out, around the corner there is Herón City, a shopping mall and a food court and take your smartphone or PC with you. Only secons away there is Corte Inglés, large shopping mall with grocery store. Wide selection of jamón and warm baguettes will make you hungry. After c/o, if you want to avoid crowds on your way to the airport, go 1 station from Fabra i Puig to Sant Andreu, then go to the Sant Andreu Comtal train station (it takes about 3 minutes) and then take the train to El Prat. Hotel is for those, who don't mind that you'll get a nice adventure getting to it. Gather some info about the city and your possibilities and you'll be fine. And it's not on Placa Catalunya :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinicius_Morais
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Everything you expect from a Ibis - clean and reasonable prices. It's a 15 min walk to the closest subway station. From there in more 15 min you are in Plaza Catalunya. Ok, it is not very close to action, but I think the price worths. Anyway it is located in a nice neighborhood, near to a park, and it has a smal shopping center and a very big Corte Ingles a few steps from the hotel. I recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL IN THE BREAKFAST AREA”
Reviews.Author: icampos77
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience in IBIS MERIDIANA in Barcelona.My mother was stolen during the breakfast. Her purse was taken by a woman (not a guest) who easily entered and left the breakfast area. The level of security is extremely poor and the hotel has no procedure to guarantee the safety of the ones paying to have breakfast there.To worsen the situation, the manager was there and did not identify herself after the occurred. We have lost approximately 1000 euros plus a digital cam with all our photos. Although the staff helped us, they kept emphasizing they were not legally responsible for what happened. I believe that even though the hotel is not legally responsible for the breakfeast area, the hotel should have procedures to avoid this type of situation. We have stayed in Ibis in Paris and Lisbon as well where there was a really good control of whom could access the breakfast area. In Lisbon, for example, there is a voucher to each day of the breakfast and guest can only enter the breakfast area after handing the voucher to one member of the staff. I received an e-mail to evaluate Ibis Meridiana quality and after reported the fact I just received a standard response.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RamonaCuciuch
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a good location, near Fabra i Puig metro station. From there, you could reach the center in about 15 - 20 min. Near it there was this big mall/center , Heron City and one El corte ingles. That made it a good place for shopping after wandering around town or eating out. The place was clean. The rooms as small, but decent. The only problem that i saw : the windows did not open. at all. The guys at the reception were really frendly, helping out every time they could. Breakfast was also good. They had what you always get at IBIS: cereals, milk, honey, butter, jamon, coffee, tee, etc etc. All in one, a pleasant place to be. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel, because you pay cheap.”
Reviews.Author: suitraveller
Reviews.Content: We have researched this hotel before we decided to stay. The location is far outside the center; that's ok. We need to walk 15 mins from the closest metro line (Fabra i Puig); that's fine. We have looked the location with the google street view, which is located in the middle of a shopping street (the Hebron City); that looks nice. Sport centers are around, quite neighborhood, old people walking and jogging if you walk to the metro station, which are a very nice location to stay. Actually, when I walked in the early morning, the air was so fresh and gave you a strong energy to start wandering the city. So we do not have any complaints with the location. Basically, we chose this hotel because of its value against the price, which was totally wrong. Yes it's cheap compared to other hotels in Barcelona, but you deserved to get mediocre room. The floor was not properly cleaned when we entered. I spotted some dust and dried leafs around. Don't expect many amenities: there was no trash bin (only a small one in the bathroom), no tissues, not enough eletric plugs for our mobile devices, etc. The bathroom was a cheap plastic shower cabin with several broken tiles. Cooling system, I think, was not an air con but it felt like a fan. Luckily, the temp outside was not yet hot. After one other stay later at Ibis Zurich, we concluded that it was the Ibis standard. You pay cheap to get below average room and service. We would not stay at Ibis again, because with a little bit more money, you can get a decent hotel at its sister, Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and decent”
Reviews.Author: vasudhachara
Reviews.Content: We had a family room with a double bed and a child's bed. There was hardly any room for the luggage. But since we were driving we left our luggage in the car and brought with us only what we needed for that night. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The location was good with easy access to: 1. A neighborhood park 2. Shopping area right next door (there is even a Corte Ingles) 3. Rides for little children 4. Grocery store 5. Public transportation

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for appalling service”
Reviews.Author: luveuropa
Reviews.Content: Think of the name Barcelona, and you unconsciously expect prices to be inflated. So what better way to control your costs than to take the Ibis? Not. The central Ibis in Barcelona was a rather obscene 89€. So this certainly isn’t for the budget traveler. For this, you get the bog standard Ibis – although there is the luxury of air-conditioning to deal with the hot Spanish summers. I’m usually tolerant of so called “rude” staff – more often than not, the rudeness is triggered by irate customers who don’t show the slightest of courtesy. But this time, I experienced dismal, APPALLING service. My mate presented his passport, and the receptionist tried to note his date of birth into the computer. Unfortunately, my friend’s passport had an incorrect birth date on the front, so he showed her a different page where the correction was noted. Up to this point, things were ok. But when she took my passport, she said something to the effect of “your passport is also going to have something wrong – so better show me the correction page first”. We were polite and courteous all along, so even if this was a genuine question, the sarcasm was completely unprovoked. Even if a receptionist was having a bad day, this is no way to treat a guest. To top it all – they gave us a ‘disabled’ room even though there were other rooms available! What surprised me was the attitude showed not just by one reception attendant, but rather everyone. Ibis may claim that their hotel is in the centre of Barcelona, but I’d take it with a pinch of salt. It’s about 10mins walk from the metro station of ‘Fabra i Puig’. Luckily, the station sits on line L1, which means it is very easy to get to from the bus station Estació del Nord (10mins), and the real city centre. If you’re inclined to take a city tour while going to the city centre, then just take bus 36 from right outside the hotel for a leisurely hour going through the annals of Barcelona. Useful tip: The hotel has a guide detailing all bus routes operating in the city, including night buses – and is kept at the Internet Access Terminal. Perfect if you’re not enthused by the idea of a conversation with bus drivers in Catalan! I wouldn’t judge a hotel by my experience with a ridiculous receptionist – but aside from a park next door, this Ibis has precious little else going for it in other departments either – it’s neither central, nor cheap, nor next to some facilities, and certainly not exceptional. You can certainly find somewhere better to stay, and use the unbelievably well-thought out TMB network to tour the beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels we've ever stayed in."”
Reviews.Author: ahp10
Reviews.Content: This Ibis is awful. We stayed in a good Ibis in Prague so we were optimistic about this hotel. What we found was horrible. The hotel could not adjust the heat so the room was hot all the time. The windows would not open, but we finally convinced the staff that we wouldn't jump so they did unlock the windows. This provided a bit of relief. The room was very small and the bathroom was the size of a cheap cruise facility. A burnt-out light was never replaced despite several requests. Unfortunately, the hotel is directly above a rock club. As a result loud music reverberated throughout the hotel from 12 am to 6 am! We could not sleep. The whole experience was awful. The hotel is a 20 minute walk to the subway. Then it is a 15 minute ride to the city. There are more reasonable rooms in the city within walking distance of the major sites. Although our reservation included breakfast, the hotel added it to our bill. The food was at best mediocre and cost far more than it was worth. I would avoid this hotel at all cost. We found much better lodging in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juliadrusilla
Reviews.Content: Ibis is Ibis everywhere - sometimes it's difficult to know where you are when you wake up in the morning! But this hotel has the advantage of having a very nice team of young professionals to welcome their guests. Between them they speak lots of languages besides Spanish and Catalan, such as English, French and German. The service is very good. Also, the hotel is close to a metro station (Fabre i Puig) for easy access to the rest of the city. There is a very big El Corte Ingles store next to the hotel and a parking garage (paid, but with a discount for hotel guests) close by. This hotel is a very good choice if you come by car and also want to visit the area around Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “What to say, I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: jeanpereira
Reviews.Content: Almost everything you'll read in these reviews is true. First it is an regular Ibis, second it is a little far from Subway station (even more if you are carrying you luggage like i did). But its location between a "Corte ingles" (a giant store) and a little mall is perfect. The rest is exactly what you expect. A nice Ibis with a nice view of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Barcelona Meridiana”
Reviews.Author: ettyus
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel located 300 meters away from the subway station near a commercial center El Corte Engles Outlet and many shops and a cinema and many fast food restaurants. The staff is gracious and willing to help, breakfast is varied and excellent coffee, is my first visit to an Ibis hotel but I was delighted by room size, cleanliness and the way I was treated. Minuses that would be very thin walls but the neighbors noise can be ignored after a day of the Barcelona visited. It is easily reached from airport to the Renfe station St. Andreu Arenal or by bus or subway, but most easily reached by RENFE and is very profitable subscription to the subway for 5 days and is valid on all means of transport in common

Reviews.Title: “it does what it says on the tin!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: briansintouch
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here because it was only 12 minutes from Catelunya square on the underground, of which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel, The hotel is to a high standard ie clean room bathroom etc, Breakfast 6.5 euros take it or leave it normal cold buffet type food never changing each day, but enough to fill up on. One night the hotel ran out of replacement bath trowels and were told they may arrive later that night, when mentioned that the hotel bill will then be free if not sorted out in 15 minutes they quickly purchased new ones from the department store, Local Supermarket under the hotel , and plenty of resturants cafes in the complex next door 2 local atm bank machines, surprised that the hotel did not exchange currancy overall a good hotel to use as a base and to chill out in the complex (Heron City) on return each night,

Reviews.Title: “Great place (especially for the money)”
Reviews.Author: enigmajic
Reviews.Content: A lot of nice things have been said about this hotel, so I'm not going to repeat too much of it. While in the outer skirts of Barcelona proper, it is still metro-accessible and has a wonderful view of the city towards the mountains. And I later found out during the three days I was there that it was also very close to the Sant Andreas (sp?) train station where you can take a train to the airport. Nice sized rooms with double bed, but the mattress was on the harder side. The rooms are clean but the amenities are on the sparse side. Though I do appreciate the inclusion of soap dispensers for the sink and the shower - saves my supply for other later hotels I'll need them in. Bar opened 24hrs and the staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel and any other of the Accor line for any of your vacation needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel For The Money”
Reviews.Author: Lottodrmr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in May 2008. There is a convenience store right next door and a mall directly behind the property. The metro Fabra I Puig is a 20 minute walk away. The room was clean with a shower, air conditioning, and a beautiful view of Barcelona if you request the upper floor. A blow dryer required a 20 Euro deposit which was promptly refunded upon checkout. The iron was another story. We asked for an iron everytime that we walked by the front desk, was granted one on the third day and told that an iron is not guaranteed. We returned it the very next day in respect to other guests. OVERALL, I LIKED THIS BASIC HOTEL AT 89EUROS NIGHTLY, AND WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: dwebb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with a tour group. This was the first time I had ever stayed in a European hotel so I wasn't sure what standards/expectations, but I was very happy with this hotel. I was in a room with one large bed in the middle and a twin bed next to the window (which I found more comfortable). The room and the bathroom are definitely on the smaller side, and can be tight for two or more people in terms of storage space - it could just be easier to work out of a suitcase than use the included shelves. The air conditioning worked fine. There were plenty of channels on the new flatscreen television. The hotel does offer wi-fi for a price. I purchased it daily for 12 Euros with tax (an hour is 6 euros). Purchasing is kind of complicated, I've never had to provide a passport number when buying internet before. The speed is a bit on the slower side, but not terrible. It can probably be best compared to home DSL. There is a bar/restaurant downstairs. The breakfast every morning offered the same selection of meats, breads, and cheeses, every day, but it was very good. Food is available from this area for lunch/dinner, though I did not try it. The staff didn't seem to have a problem with people using it to hang around even though they weren't ordering anything. Staff was always very helpful and spoke English quite well if that's a concern. No complaints with them! The hotel lobby was always clean, and maid service was very good. In terms of getting around, there is a subway stop (Fabra i Puig) that is a 5-10 minute walk away. Overall a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A modern Ibis hotel”
Reviews.Author: AESCH
Reviews.Content: I stayed last week at this property and found it quite ok, it was not hot and the air-con was therefore not necessary, it was February and very quiet. PRO: - easy parking just at the shopping centre next door, rate acceptable 16 Euros for a day - hotel modern, room well equipped, excellent bed, good TV offer, found room clean and comfortable, excellent shower ... - staff multilingual, professional and nice - breakfast buffet, quite good except for the baguette which was not fresh and the croissants which were covered with sugar .... CON: - area could be nicer, a shopping mall is really not the nicest position for an hotel .... - no restaurant but the receptionist gave us some addresses where we were offered discounted prices, in the shopping centre ASADOR LA PATAGONIA is quite good, excellent argentinian beef, good wines at reasonable prices, service very efficient ALL IN ALL NOT A BAD HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff but ordinary rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jhureley
Reviews.Content: Hotel of location is very good... 10 mins from centre of Barcelona 5 mins walk from Metro and Bus Stop. Staff is very good, welcoming and helpful. Rooms are ordinary.. bed was really bad, ours was making screeching noise everytime we moved... and Air Conditioning was worse... couldn't sleep whole night [3 nights]... we were feeling lack of oxygen... in the room..
